The Alternative Therapies programme for drug addiction, subsidised by Taiwan's Ministry of Health and Welfare, was introduced in 2006, and the Ministry's needle exchange programme was implemented in 2005.
347 At the end of 2016, 179 institutions throughout Taiwan were providing alternative therapy for drug use. The Ministry of Health and Welfare also subsidised health institutions to provide treatment for drug and alcohol addiction in correctional facilities. In 2016, four health institutions offered services at five correctional facilities.
